verbs.description: introspect (third-person singular simple present introspects, present participle introspecting, simple past and past participle introspected)

examples: Second, to say that something is introspectible, that we can introspect it, is not to imply that we are in fact aware of it. What's more, I haven't claimed that we even can introspect all the thoughts we have, only that we can introspect that we have two important sorts of thoughts.

entries.meaning: (transitive, programming) To examine by means of type introspection.
examples: DynamicMBeanFacade uses Java's reflection API to introspect the managed resource and discover data type information for attributes.
